SEARCH
Module FloWeekTracker
Package com.floweektracker.main

Class Main

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Window
java.awt.Frame
javax.swing.JFrame
com.floweektracker.main.Main
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, Accessible, RootPaneContainer, WindowConstants
public class Main extends JFrame
Represents the Main instance and serves as the entry point for the application. It initializes main user interface components and manages the application's lifecycle. Additionally, ths class handles the creation of necessary directories for storing application data.

Fields:
  • plannerFolder - a static File reference to the directory where application files are stored
  • mainCards - a JPanel reference using CardLayout to manage different panels in the application
  • mainPanelUI - a MainPanelUI reference representing the main user interface panel
  • infoPanelsUI - an array of InfoPanelUI references representing different informational panels in the application
Methods:
  • createDirectory() - creates directory where working files are stored
  • configureFrame() - sets up JFrame elements such as title, size, and visibility
  • configureMainCards() - adds all panels to mainCards
  • initializeListeners() - creates a new instance of MainListeners, which adds listeners to the elements contained in MainPanel and InfoPanel
  • showErrorDialog(String, String) - creates and shows error dialog based on provided information
  • setPanelSize(String) - changes JFrame's size based on visible JPanel in mainCards
Getters: getMainCards()
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Field Details

    • plannerFolder

      public static File plannerFolder
      Contains a File instance representing the FloWeekTracker directory, where application files are stored. This variable is used to save or load data from .json files located in the FloWeekTracker directory.
      See Also:
      • createDirectory()
      • PlannerDataManager
      • TasksDatabaseManager

    • mainCards

      private final JPanel mainCards
      Contains multiple JPanel instances managed by a CardLayout which allows displaying one panel at a time. The user can switch between these JPanel instances to interact with application. Contains:
      • one panel from MainPanelUI representing the main panel shown to the user at the beginning
      • two panels from InfoPanelUI representing information about the base and planner usage
      • seven panels from WeekDayPanelUI representing the schedule for each day of the week
      See Also:
      • configureMainCards()
      • setPanelSize(String)

    • mainPanelUI

      private final MainPanelUI mainPanelUI
      Contains an instance of MainPanelUI which is used to create and deliver the main panel to mainCards.
      See Also:
      • configureMainCards()
      • initializeListeners()

    • infoPanelsUI

      private final InfoPanelUI[] infoPanelsUI
      Contains instances of InfoPanelUI used creating and delivering panels with information to mainCards
      See Also:
      • configureMainCards()
      • initializeListeners()

  • Constructor Details

    • Main

      public Main()
      Constructs a new Main instance serving as the entry point for the application. Creates a directory for application's working files using the createDirectory() method and then initializes the mainPanelUI, infoPanelsUI and mainCards instances.

      Invokes the configureMainCards() method to add panels to mainCards, and the initializeListeners() method to add listeners to the components in the information panels and the main panel. Finally, the constructor uses configureFrame() to configure the JFrame.
      See Also:
      • Main
      • MainPanelUI
      • InfoPanelUI

  • Method Details

    • createDirectory

      private File createDirectory()
      Creates a FloWeekTracker directory, where necessary application's files are stored. It creates a JOptionPane confirm dialog with JOptionPane.YES_NO_CANCEL_OPTION, where user is informed about creating the directory in the default localization and is asked for permission.

      If the user clicks JOptionPane.YES_OPTION, the directory will be created.

      If the user clicks JOptionPane.NO_OPTION, the user can choose another localization for folder or select one that already exists.

      If the user clicks JOptionPane.CANCEL_OPTION, the program will exit without creating the directory.

      Returns:
      a File object representing the FloWeekTracker directory or null if the user cancels the operation.
      See Also:
      • plannerFolder
      • Main()

    • configureMainCards

      private void configureMainCards()
      Adds JPanel instances from mainPanelUI and infoPanelsUI to mainCards.
      See Also:
      • MainPanelUI.getMainPanel()
      • InfoPanelUI.getInfoPanel()
      • Main()

    • initializeListeners

      private void initializeListeners()
      Creates a new instance of MainListeners, which creates, delivers and adds listeners to the elements contained in the mainPanelUI and infoPanelsUI instances.
      See Also:
      • Main()

    • configureFrame

      private void configureFrame()
      Configures app's frame by adding mainCards to JFrame. Also sets title, app's icon, size, resizability, frame's location closing operation and frame's visibility.

      If the app's icon cannot be set, an error dialog is displayed informing the user that the icon could not be added.

      See Also:
      • setPanelSize(String)
      • Main()

    • showErrorDialog

      public static void showErrorDialog(String title, String message)
      Creates a JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE based on provided information about title and message. This method is used to show error messages to the user.
      Parameters:
      title - a title for the JOptionPane
      message - a message which is shown to the user

    • setPanelSize

      public void setPanelSize(String panelName)
      Sets the size of the JFrame based on the panelName. Filters the components from mainCards to find a JPanel component with name matching the panelName. Gets the size of the filtered JPanel and sets it for mainCards.
      Parameters:
      panelName - a String containing the name of the panel from which the JFrame size is set

    • getMainCards

      public JPanel getMainCards()
      Returns:
      a mainCards containing panels from the mainPanelUI and infoPanelsUI instances.
      See Also:
      • configureMainCards()

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method which serves as the entry point to the application. It initializes the application by creating an instance of the Main class.
      Parameters:
      args - command line arguments passed to the application (no used)
